on the rest of the house so there was a
lot of clutter and random stuff a lying
around the first thing was obviously to
clear everything out and not only that
but to also find a place in a home for
everything so I started off with the big
stuff and just putting everything away
where it's supposed to be I had the
storage unit that I needed to clear out
because I wanted to repurpose it and I
didn't have enough space in this room
for it anyways so I just cleared out all
the drawers onto the floor so that I
could see everything at a glance and I
could decide where everything's supposed
to go because this room is so small I
only wanted to store the essentials in
here so that's why I didn't keep this
unit but luckily my bedroom is right
next door
so I stored everything away in there and
if I need anything while I'm working
it's still really close by there were
lots of screws in the walls from the
previous tenants and I couldn't really
use them for anything because of the way
they were placed so I just went ahead
and fixed all the holes in the walls
it was so satisfying to see the room all
cleared out and this is what it looks
like you can tell it's a really small
room and there's lots of things that I
needed to use it for so I made some
sketches just to figure out how I can
make it work I started off with the
things that I knew for sure so I knew I
had to have a filming desk and I had to
put it against the window to get natural
light and I also needed another desk for
my computer and work I really wanted to
have a place where I could relax so I
thought an armchair would go perfectly
next to the door and then the rest of
the space I pretty much just used for
storage and decoration and I also knew I
wanted to put a rug in here to make
things easier I decided from the start
that my color scheme was going to be
bamboo white black and green of course
because I wanted to have a lot of plants
the first thing that I absolutely knew I
wanted to do was to replace at the door
this room is so small and that solid
door was closing it off even more so I
got another one from Wayfarer it was
really difficult to install the door not
gonna lie it took a lot of hours because
we had to cut out space for the hinges
and also for the log which I actually
chose to have this tiny simple one that
didn't require as much work as regular
ones I just put these simple knobs which
screwed into the door so that way I
didn't have to drill through the whole
thing and I only used one screw to
secure them just in case I wanted to
switch them later on so I didn't want to
make too many holes but this door has
glass panels so when you close it it
doesn't feel like you're in this tiny
space and I also love the color of it
much more it's gonna go really well with
the rest of the furniture
the first piece of furniture that I
assembled was the shelving system from
Ikea which has these two vertical bars
that screw into the wall in three points
each so it was a bit of a challenge to
make sure everything was straight and
spaced out properly but after about an
hour so I managed to install them the
first shelf that I put on here is the
one with the drawers this is actually
meant to be used as a desk if you wanted
but it's a way too narrow for me I just
got it for the extra storage in those
drawers and I also think it adds a bit
more interest than regular shelves I

didn't use the knobs that came with the

I have a small collection of knobs

they're plain white and see-through and
